text: Ruth Mosselle Apilado (n√©e Mays; April 30, 1908 - August 15, 2021) was an American writer and anti-racism activist. She was known as the founder of the quarterly magazine America's Intercultural Magazine (AIM). She founded AIM in 1973. Apilado was born in Chicago, Illinois. She turned 100 in 2008, and 110 in 2018. Apilado died on August 15, 2021 in Federal Way, Washington at the age of 113. ==References== Category:1908 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American civil rights activists Category:American novelists Category:American supercentenarians Category:Writers from Chicago
